conclusion: Analyze the motion of the particle in both the magnetic field and the electric field.
Break down the problem into two parts: the motion in the magnetic field and the motion in the electric field.
The particle is injected from the origin O with an initial velocity v0 at a 45° angle to the y-axis.
The velocity components are vx = v0 cos(45°) = v0/√2 and vy = v0 sin(45°) = v0/√2.
The particle moves in a circular path due to the magnetic field.
The radius r of the circular path is given by r = mv0/qB.
The path is a quarter circle because the initial angle is 45°.
The time t1 to complete a quarter circle is 1/4 of the period of the circular motion.
The particle moves with a constant horizontal velocity vx = v0/√2.
The vertical motion is uniformly accelerated due to the electric field.
The vertical displacement y = L is given by y = 1/2 at^2, where a = qE/m.
Solving for time t2, we get t2 = √(2mL/qE).
The horizontal displacement x = 3L is given by x = vx t2.
Using vx = v0/√2, we find t2 = 3L√2/v0.
The total time t is the sum of t1 and t2.
The time taken for the particle to move from point O to point P is t = πm/2qB + 3L√2/v0.
